subject: Career
title: Parkinson's Law and Time Boundaries
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Parkinson's Law and Time Boundaries.

hook.text: Work expands to fill the time available. At home, with no commute deadline, work can expand to fill all day.

buildup.text: Parkinson's Law, coined in 1955, explains why remote workers often work longer hours, not fewer.

discovery.text: Without a physical 'leaving the office' signal, the workday has no natural end.

twist.text: The fix: set artificial deadlines. 'I stop at 6 PM' creates the constraint Parkinson's Law needs.

climax.text: Use time-boxing: allocate fixed time to tasks. When time's up, move on. Constraints boost creativity.

punchline.text: Set a boundary or work will consume every hour.

quiz.question: What does Parkinson's Law say about work?
options: Work expands to fill the time available
Work always takes the minimum time
